channel.title: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp
channel.description:
please dont flame, im new to creating servers and ive read several tutorials all telling me to port forward which idk but i cant frickin do it...ive done, file>run>command>ipconfig/all
i get all the ip address ive typed every single one in my address bar this is my message * The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.
* If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer's network connection.
* If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the Web.
wtf...someone help?
and when you go to portforward.com i find my router but then what program do i click on theres no moparscape or anything near it so...wtf do i do?
also we have four computers running off one router, should that make a difference? mine is not hardwired im wireless, please let me know if this would possibly affect anything?

item.title: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp
item.dc:creator: @yoyo1234 yoyo1234
item.description:
@yoyo1234 wrote:

ugh…okay thanks for the effort but this is whats happenning now

i type http://192.168.1.1. and all i get is a white screen, im using Mozzila Firefox and i also tried Internet Explorer, on IE i was only given a connection error

Read full topic
item.source: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp

item.title: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp
item.dc:creator: @LeScape_Pk LeScape Pk
item.description:
@LeScape_Pk wrote:

select the default tut for ur router… -.- and bumping isnt alowed.

Read full topic
item.source: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp

item.title: I SERIOUSLY need a lttle help from someone who has A LOT of port forwarding exp
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Do it like this:
www.portforward.com
Click “PortForwarding” at the top of the page
Select the router that you have from the list
Select the application you are port forwarding for, select the first option, 1st SMTP server
Follow the step-by-step tutorial on port forwarding your exact router.

Read full topic
